meanings.definition: One who predicts or prophesies future events.
meanings.sent1: The foreteller warned the villagers of the impending storm.
meanings.sent2: The foreteller's predictions often came true.
meanings.sent3: The foreteller jokingly claimed to know when the next squirrel race would be.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother was a foreteller of good fortune, always bringing luck wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The foreteller's crystal ball gleamed with mysterious visions of the future.

meanings.definition: To predict or prophesy future events.
meanings.sent1: She tried to foretell the outcome of the game using her intuition.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts foretell a great battle that will determine the fate of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecaster jokingly foretold a snowstorm in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent4: His dreams often foretell events that later come true in real life.
meanings.sent5: The old wise woman's words seemed to foretell the future with uncanny accuracy.
